channel.title: RSPS discussion
channel.description:
We need a board for it.
I know you all support, so yeah

item.title: RSPS discussion
item.dc:creator: @rash Rash
item.description:
@rash wrote:

[quote=“Scape-JAVA, post:27, topic:388982”][quote author=I Vain I link=topic=484801.msg3554925#msg3554925 date=1301802528]

I think this could be a great suggest. My only worry is more of a work load (Cause I’m lazy). This type of section could be abused really easily, therefore more reports coming in for us to deal with (not too bad I guess).

Lets move onto the positives.
This could help the cluster fuck in the server help section, people could ask whats a good server name amongst this section, the questions that are related to servers but aren’t related to server help and what-not. So I think this could actually work.
[/quote]Those were my points exactly. I even stated the staff would hate it.

I guess you guys could be a bit less lenient on the ‘warnings’ or however you guys do it. Such as, no warnings to anyone’s account whom has been registered long enough to have read the rules. First time posters etc. should have warnings. As you know; half the people in server help don’t read the rules.

I would of seen it the other way around.

If members here who have been registered for sometime, who should know the rules by now would receive a worse warning then a new member who doesn’t know the rules as well. Therefore, it would justify as harsher punishment for an older member and a less lenient punishment for a newer member.

However, I would probably still warn them equally.[/quote]

TOMSCAPE will want to prove himself, assign that to him

Read full topic

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=Scape-JAVA link=topic=484801.msg3554924#msg3554924 date=1301802337]
I think this could be a great suggest. My only worry is more of a work load (Cause I’m lazy). This type of section could be abused really easily, therefore more reports coming in for us to deal with (not too bad I guess).

Lets move onto the positives.
This could help the cluster fuck in the server help section, people could ask whats a good server name amongst this section, the questions that are related to servers but aren’t related to server help and what-not. So I think this could actually work.
[/quote]Those were my points exactly. I even stated the staff would hate it.

I guess you guys could be a bit less lenient on the ‘warnings’ or however you guys do it. Such as, no warnings to anyone’s account whom has been registered long enough to have read the rules. First time posters etc. should have warnings. As you know; half the people in server help don’t read the rules.[/quote]

I would of seen it the other way around.

If members here who have been registered for sometime, who should know the rules by now would receive a worse warning then a new member who doesn’t know the rules as well. Therefore, it would justify as harsher punishment for an older member and a less lenient punishment for a newer member.

However, I would probably still warn them equally.

item.title: RSPS discussion
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=Mod Whip link=topic=484801.msg3554837#msg3554837 date=1301798247]
Just out of curiosity, what would such a board be used for? Just general discussion on servers? Probably would be 95% advertisements then lol… Most of the RSPS related stuff fits into the categories that currently exist
[/quote]Questions like good experience rates, good home locations, discussion good content updates and the best ways to go about adding those, etc. People could also discuss the changes between revisions, etc.[/quote]

I once thought about making a bytecode analyzer to compare two different servers, and create a “database” of the same methods for each server(for example, client.getActionSender() for Delta, and ActionSender.getInstance() for w/e else) so that people could easily convert methods from one server to another. Then I realized how horribly [most] servers are programmed and gave up.

Read full topic

item.title: RSPS discussion
item.dc:creator: @rash Rash
item.description:
@rash wrote:

[quote=“xxlukexx, post:11, topic:388982”]Rash, what have you been on lately.
All these stupid ideas. Im with you that its a RSPS forum but again, it will be fucked over with spam/troll.[/quote]

I want this community to expand.

[quote=“I Vain I, post:1, topic:389203”]Debating the legitimacy of the board’s use is no doubt stupid. Of course the board will be abused, but tell me this; which board(s) isn’t abused?

Discussion of RSPS can be both good and bad at the same time. Some people would love to discuss simple things like old servers they played, content updates they wish to add, ideas for other servers, and other things. This could also be a wonderful way to clear out the server help with stupid questions like; “What’s a good server name?”, “What are good experience rates?”, “Where should my home be located on my server?” etc. This could put the server help section in a little more controlled environment as well as creating a fun place to discuss servers in general. However, this will also be another board which staff would have to monitor, causing either more reports, or more time to watch boards etc. As long as we* put rules in act, and enforce them correctly, this shouldn’t be any problem.

* denotes the staff team of mscp.[/quote]

Well, I was going to write a paragraph, but you did it for me.

Read full topic
